column4: Hi, all. Can anyone help me with configuring Broadcom 4310 please! I can't solve the problem for the last two days
Sure, type this in a terminal, lspci | grep Broad
I would do this: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install ndisgtk unzip && wget http://myspamb8.googlepages.com/R174291-pruned.zip && unzip R174291-pruned.zip
Once that completes, click system -> administration -> windows wireless drivers, and browse to the .inf file that the unzip command creates, tell it to use that .inf file
